Description: Hollow terracotta figure of Demeter standing on a flat-faced plinth, wearing a chiton, and a himation draped over her head, which is diademed. She holds a large torch against her left side. Nonsense hieroglyphs were incised into the plinth in modern times. The back is plain, except for a raised rim round a circular vent. There is slight linear damage on right side of neck. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt; brown surface. Traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Rollin and Feuardent, dealers. Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Close, probably from same mould-series: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1956.958; Bayer-Niemeier 1988: nos 392-7, all from the Fayum, dated first century AD; Besques 1992: nos D/E 4496 and D/E 4498-9, all from Middle Egypt and dated to the late Ptolemaic period (D/E 4498 = Ballet 1998: 229, fig. 16, D/E 4499 = Ballet 1997: 256, fig. 9); Dunand 1990: no. 66, dated Roman period; Paul 1959: no. 283, dated Roman period; Petrie Museum uc50511, from the Fayum; Pingiatoglou 1993: no.271 (head broken from figure); Schmidt 1997: no. 81, dated second century AD; Török 1995: nos 29, dated first century BC or later, and 30, acquired at Memphis, a later generation version of no. 29; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 45; Warmenbol 1998: 268, pl. 1:2; Weber 1914: no. 297, said to be from the Fayum. Near: Besques 1992: no. D/E 4497, from Middle Egypt, dated late Hellenistic (= Ballet 1997: 256, fig. 10 and Ballet 1998: 229, fig. 15); Breccia 1934: pl. xlviii:239; Dunand 1990: no. 69 (= del Francia Barocus 1998: 65: no. 34), from Antinoopolis, dated second to third century AD (= perhaps Guimet 1903: pl. iii, from the fabricated Tomb of Leukyoné at Antinoopolis); Ewigleben and von Grumbkow 1991: no. 70; Fischer 1994: no. 900, dated first half of second century AD = Vogt 1924: pl. v:1; Pingiatoglou 1993: no. 2, dated first century AD; Schmidt 1994: no. 270, dated first century AD; Weber 1914: no. 296, said to be from the Fayum. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: no. 900.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3328)
